semantic_title: Etiology/Manifestation Convention - Code First and Use Additional Code Instructions
section_path: Section I > A. Conventions > 13. Etiology/manifestation convention

content.full_text: Certain conditions have both an underlying etiology and multiple body system manifestations due to the underlying etiology. For such conditions, the ICD-10-CM has a coding convention that requires the underlying condition be sequenced first, if applicable, followed by the manifestation. Wherever such a combination exists, there is a "use additional code" note at the etiology code, and a "code first" note at the manifestation code. These instructional notes indicate the proper sequencing order of the codes, etiology followed by manifestation. In most cases the manifestation codes will have in the code title, "in diseases classified elsewhere." Codes with this title are a component of the etiology/manifestation convention. The code title indicates that it is a manifestation code. "In diseases classified elsewhere" codes are never permitted to be used as first listed or principal diagnosis codes. They must be used in conjunction with an underlying condition code and they must be listed following the underlying condition. (Evidence: pg no: 10-11, L32-L37)
content.summary: Convention requiring etiology codes to be sequenced first, followed by manifestation codes, with specific instructional notes guiding proper sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 10-11, L32-L37)
key_concepts: Underlying etiology sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 10, L35)
Manifestation codes follow etiology (Evidence: pg no: 10, L35-L36)
Use additional code note at etiology (Evidence: pg no: 10, L36)
Code first note at manifestation (Evidence: pg no: 10, L36-L37)
In diseases classified elsewhere codes are manifestations (Evidence: pg no: 10, L37)
Manifestation codes never used as principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 10-11, L37)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Underlying condition must be sequenced first, followed by manifestation (Evidence: pg no: 10, L35-L36)
detailed_rules.explanation: This convention ensures proper representation of causal relationships between conditions (Evidence: pg no: 10, L34-L36)

detailed_rules.rule_text: In diseases classified elsewhere codes never permitted as first listed or principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 10-11, L37)
detailed_rules.explanation: These codes must always be secondary to underlying condition code (Evidence: pg no: 10-11, L37)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify etiology and manifestation relationship
Step 2: Locate 'use additional code' note at etiology
Step 3: Locate 'code first' note at manifestation

specific_codes.description: Dementia in other diseases classified elsewhere (Evidence: pg no: 10, L38)
Parkinson's disease - underlying etiology (Evidence: pg no: 10-11, L42-L43)
specific_codes.context: Must be sequenced first before dementia manifestation

specific_codes.description: Dementia in diseases classified elsewhere without behavioral disturbance (Evidence: pg no: 11, L47)
Dementia in diseases classified elsewhere with behavioral disturbance (Evidence: pg no: 11, L47)

code_patterns.description: Title pattern indicating manifestation codes (Evidence: pg no: 10, L37)
code_patterns.example: F02 Dementia in other diseases classified elsewhere
code_patterns.explanation: These codes are always manifestations and never principal diagnoses

references_to.title: Multiple coding for a single condition
references_to.explanation: Code first and use additional code notes also apply to non-etiology/manifestation combinations

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with dementia due to Parkinson's disease with behavioral disturbance
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Dementia in Parkinson's disease with behavioral disturbance
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify Parkinson's as underlying etiology
Step 3: Look up G20 for Parkinson's disease
Step 4: Look up F02.81 for dementia with behavioral disturbance
Step 5: Sequence G20 first, F02.81 second

correct_coding.rationale: Follows etiology/manifestation convention with proper sequencing (Evidence: pg no: 10-11, L41-L47)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Manifestation codes cannot be principal diagnosis
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using manifestation code as primary diagnosis

breakdown.F02.80/F02.81: Dementia manifestation with/without behavioral disturbance (Evidence: pg no: 11, L47)

examples.rationale: G20 represents underlying etiology and must be sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 11, L46)

warnings: In diseases classified elsewhere codes never permitted as first listed or principal diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 10-11, L37)
Must use underlying condition code in conjunction with manifestation code (Evidence: pg no: 10-11, L37)
best_practices: Always check for use additional code and code first notes (Evidence: pg no: 10, L36-L37)
Follow proper sequencing order: etiology followed by manifestation (Evidence: pg no: 10, L36-L37)
common_mistakes: Using manifestation codes as principal diagnosis
Incorrect sequencing of etiology and manifestation
tips: Look for 'in diseases classified elsewhere' in code titles
Check Alphabetic Index for bracketed manifestation codes
Verify instructional notes in Tabular List
implementation_notes: Alphabetic Index shows etiology first, manifestation in brackets
Some manifestation codes don't have 'in diseases classified elsewhere' in title
